str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

word: “we would not have handed Him over
parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
